properties.areaDesc: Ashtabula Lakeshore; Ashtabula Inland; Geauga; Lake
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 3:34PM EST until January 20 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland OH
properties.description:
...Heavy Lake Effect Snow Expected...

.Lake effect snow is expected to develop tonight after a cold front
moves east across the area, ushering in a seasonably cold airmass.
The heaviest lake effect snow is expected to occur during the day
Sunday, producing up to 6 to 10 inches across Erie County, PA.
Elsewhere in the primary snowbelt can anticipate 3 to 5 inches of
snow. Widespread wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph with locally higher
gusts near the lakeshore will produce blowing snow and reduced
visibilities.

* WHAT...Lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3
to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph with locally higher
gusts near the lakeshore.

* WHERE...Lake, Geauga, and Ashtabula counties.

* WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 4 AM EST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could
bring down tree branches.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest lake effect snow is expected
to occur during the day Sunday. Widespread wind gusts of 30 to
40 mph with locally higher gusts near the lakeshore will produce
blowing snow and reduced visibilities.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM EST MONDAY
